channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024010552
item.description:
Report X-2024010552

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE AND REPONDED TO CALL FOR LEAKING PACKAGE, UNLOADER HAD LEFT AREA. UPON CHECKING LABELS, RESPONDER FOUND THAT THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS LABELLED AS A FLAMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT. USING RESPONSE TREE, RESPONDER DETERMED THE PACKAGE COULD BE HANDLED IN HOUSE AND RESPONDED AS NEEDED.

item.title: Report X-2023121107
item.description:
Report X-2023121107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the SEAR facility a undeclared shipment was discovered during sort operations. The shipment contained a UN1950 and there were no DG markings or paperwork on the packaging. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held for the FAA.
